If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements. Use these captions as a reference, but do not rely on them completely. Your goal is to fully capture the spatial framing and movements in this video. The hubcap features a multi-spoke design with numerous thin, vertical slots radiating from a solid central disc. Human-Written Description for Scenery: **In an outdoor setting during the day, a single black car tire with a silver, multi-spoke hubcap rolls along a concrete surface. The camera rotates in sync with the tire, keeping it centered as the background, which includes the light-colored horizontal siding and wooden trim of a building, spins around it. The scene is illuminated by diffuse, even light.**

Please note that the video features **salient non-human subjects**, so you should focus on describing the spatial framing and movements of them.
